summary: To help address the growing rate of military suicides, DOD provides clinical treatment such as medication to servicemembers. DOD has also implemented various non-clinical suicide prevention efforts, such as distributing gun locks and providing suicide awareness training. How are these non-clinical interventions working? In short, DOD assesses its entire suicide prevention program, but hasn't assessed all of the efforts individually. Each one should be assessed...
title: Defense Health Care: DOD Needs to Fully Assess Its Non-clinical Suicide Prevention Efforts and Address Any Impediments to Effectiveness
